column2: Morr is the God of the Dead, Dreams and Dreamers. He holds sway over illusions and all things that are not what they seem. A contemplative god, he guards the souls of the departed from Chaos and necromancers, just as his priests guard the corpses buried in the Gardens of Morr, and protects the dreams of the sleeping from Daemons that would pervert them. Morr and his devoted followers are the eternal enemies of the Undead, and guardians against grave and tomb robbers. The Cult of Morr is not a popular one, but is of singular importance in the religious life of the Old World, for all come to Morr’s gate eventually.

The Fellowship of the Shroud or The High and Chivalric Order of Deserved Rest, better known as the Raven Knights. They are dedicated to destroying all Undead wherever they find them, but many are dedicated specifically to the destruction of Vampires. They welcome any devout foe of the Undead to their order, whether soldier or academic.
The Grandmaster of the Knights of the Raven.

column1: #For tooltip that require being a member

column2: Is a member of the Fellowship of the Shroud.

column1: #Rank up decision if you made a custom one, alongside the required custom_local

column15: x #the _stacked is for when there is several modifiers added to each others, so make them plural.

column2: We would be honored, if you joined the High and Chivalric Order of Deserved Rest.
You have been tasked with hunting down a Vampire. We can not let its unholy appearance stalk the lands.
§GRight click§! on the portrait of a vampire to hunt it down.
A town has fallen under vampiric domination. You need to cleanse it of their false gods
§GRight click§ on a settlement that fell prey to vampirism to cleanse it.
If you decline, you won't be offered another quest for the next few years.
As a Raven Knight, your duty is to rid the world of abominations known as Vampires. Their existence mocks Morr and the Deserved rest. Eradicate one, for the order!
I am ready to face the abominations.
But... I am not ready yet!
I have eradicated the beast! Its presence mocks Morr no more.
Now to crack myself a cold one.
Vampires spread their influence over the petrified populace, using them as cattle and slaves. Your duty is to eradicate such presence and liberate the suffering people from their vampiric shackles!
The humans here are worshipping the Vampire filth as gods! This cannot stand, I need to wipe these monsters from the world.
Try to kill only the undead population.
Kill the undead and their worshippers.
You have arrived at the God-forsaken settlement. How will you go about combating the Vampire threat?
Convince the locals that they're not Gods.
You go in, killing all the undead, however the human slaves are trying to stop you from killing their masters.
The town has been cleansed of the undead menace. The surviving townsmen are in hiding out of fear of joining their "now definitely dead" kinsmen.
You fought vigorously against the undead and their thralls, but in the end you are overpowered and you breathe your last.
You decided it's best to sneak in and not make your presence known to their thralls.
You've gotten in undetected and swiftly kill all the vampiric bastards, saving the town of their corruption.
You tried to convince the locals that the Vampires are not their gods, that they are monsters that feed unpon their life force, and to help you kill their former masters.
Let's hope I can bring reason to these backwards folk... ohh you poor souls.
You convince them to forsake their fake gods and help you slay them, but you can't help but think that it's only because they fear you more than them.
They will probably go back to worshipping their false gods.

The [From.GetAscetic] [From.GetBestName] has finally arrived at my court. [From.GetFirstName] is a most noble and wise [From.getmanwoman] and I will happily receive [From.GetHerHis] council in matters of religion and scholarly pursuits.
The land of [From.Location.GetName] is infested by undead. Your subjects have pleaded many times for you to fund an expedition to exterminate them.
We cannot spare anything for this.
Your expedition did their job and exterminated every last undead filth that infested your land.

The expedition had catastrophic results: not only have the undead repelled your forces, but the battle has stirred them into action, and now, if they gain further momentum, they might gather into a full horde.

A dangerous horde of Undead has risen [From.GetName]! A Necromantic Lord has rallied all of the Undead hiding in your lands, and more are being risen as we speak, with the aim of overcoming our defences, killing innocents and looting the province!
This insolence will not be tolerated!

A dangerous horde of Undead has risen [From.GetName]! An Necromantic Lord has rallied all of the Undead hiding in your lands, and more are being risen as we speak, with the aim of overcoming our defences, killing innocents and looting the province!
So, do you want to play as Otto von Nordheim or Bernhardt van Hal? (If picked, he will stop being a Witch Hunter)
As a Vampire Hunter, you have underwent special training to hunt and kill Vampires, but anybody that can kill the Night's Dark Masters should also be feared on the field of combat.
Your time within the Fellowship of the Shroud have taught you what you need to know on how to best the Night's Dark Masters
Don't die too quickly, your career has just started!

As a member of the Fellowship of the Shroud, you can undergo special training to achieve much needed skill to fight against Vampires. These skills will aid you on your hunts and help you on battlefields, especially against undead armies.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on your own character portrait, in order to give yourself a special Vampire Hunter trait.
You'll get a series of events in which you'll choose how you'd like to go about killing the Vampires.
Being part of the Fellowship of the Shroud, you have become very familiar with the Cult of Morr and have decided to embrace him as your patron god.
You have not yet been Doomed by a Doomsayer, which is said to bring ill fortune. The ritual will take but a day and a small sacrifice to Morr.
I'm ready for Morr to give me my dooming.
I don't think being Doomed by the god of death sounds like a good idea...
You have not yet been Doomed and not having a dooming is said to bring bad luck.
Ask your guardian to get a Doomsayer to foretell your dooming.
Doomsayers are freaking scary and who would want to be doomed anyway?
Your ward has asked you if you can get a Doomsayer to foretell their doom. The ritual will take no time, but a small sacrifice to Morr is required.
The little brat doesn't deserve it.
??Y$CLAIMANT$??! can wage war to take any land for his horde.
This ruler has recently thwarted the attempts of an undead horde that has risen up.
Send in your best men to cleanse the province of the undead.

Undead lingering at [Root.Location.GetName] are terrorizing the local populace. Note that stirring the undead might attract necromancers or vampires to use these mindless undead for their own purpose.
If the Cult of Morr is going to be as organized as the other cults, we must have a have a system for our Augur as well as for a High Augur.
Terrible things will happen to thy fingers if thou dippest them into too many pies
A four legged beast shall be thine death
Thy end shall be hilarious, just not thee
Thy shalt laugh in the face of death, but the last laugh shall be Morr's
Thou shalt fall under the weight of thine own gold
Beware the man that is not a man
Good advice will arrive too late
A drunken blunder shall end your comedy
Thy doom is so terrible, mortal mind cannot conceive it, nor mortal tongue tell it
A spear will pass through your belly and you will linger long in pain before your demise
The hangman's noose, aye, or headsman's chop, shall end thy days
Debauchery and revelry shall end in misery
Disease and pestilence loom over thine nether regions
It is a great honour to be made mad by the gods
Morr comes screaming to thy door
Madness and insanity shall haunt thy final hours
Morr will come calling when thou art without clothing
No tears but thy own shall be shed when Morr comes a-knocking
The hand that takes thy life is thine own
Thy blood shall water a foreign field
Thou shalt share thy grave with a dog
Thy death shall mirror your birth
Trust not gifts from the Border Princedoms
When the bell tolls midnight, all shall not be well, as thy end awaits thee
You die alone, unmourned and unloved
When the birds start to sing, you shall forever be silent
You will die, and yet walk on
When thee dost hold a mans life in one hand, thy life shall be held in his
The great maw shall devour thee
Starvation shall reduce thee to an empty husk
It'll fall off when you least expect it
Thou shall perish so others may live
The more you complain, the longer Morr lets you live
Beware of the Black mage, for he shall stab thee
A child shall be Morr's herald
Thy body may rot, but thy soul shall forever haunt the land
Beware the passing raven, for it doth herald the end
Beware the lurkers in the dark
All is not as it seems
A small misfortune leads to a bigger misfortune which leads to thy death
Among great celebration you shall leave this world
That which does not kill you has delayed the inevitable
Fear the fair maiden from the east
